title: Not possible to restart 2/4 if 2/3 was completed

content.raw:
When restarting a checkpoint, we [call](#!/osrf/srcsim/src/b43622a1dbf61ef30001ec6a5d241babe37b2015/src/Task.cc?fileviewer=file-view-default#Task.cc-68) `Skip` on the previous checkpoint, to trigger the effects of skipping, which includes resetting models and reharnessing. 

The problem is, before we supported restarts, I put a [sanity check](#!/osrf/srcsim/src/b43622a1dbf61ef30001ec6a5d241babe37b2015/src/Task2.cc?fileviewer=file-view-default#Task2.cc-257) on `Task2CP3::Skip` to prevent skipping it if it has already been completed. That prevents the harness and model resetting from happening.

I had checked that restarting 2/4 worked, but I had never tested completing 2/3 and then restarting 2/4.
content.html:
When restarting a checkpoint, we call Skip on the previous checkpoint, to trigger the effects of skipping, which includes resetting models and reharnessing.

The problem is, before we supported restarts, I put a sanity check on Task2CP3::Skip to prevent skipping it if it has already been completed. That prevents the harness and model resetting from happening.

I had checked that restarting 2/4 worked, but I had never tested completing 2/3 and then restarting 2/4.
